types.section:
{{fr-noun|mfbysense}}

# an [[appointed]] official within an [[organization]] whose duty is to investigate complaints against that organization by its [[customer]]s, [[taxpayer]]s, and sometimes [[employee]]s, and often to act as a [[consultant]] to improve services and [[process]]es

====Usage notes====
* In Quebec, the office in government services is called {{m|fr|protecteur du citoyen}}. A similar office in France is that of the {{m|fr|médiateur}}, though its precise functions differ.
types.html:
ombudsman m or f by sense (plural ombudsmans)

  1. an appointed official within an organization whose duty is to investigate complaints against that organization by its customers, taxpayers, and sometimes employees, and often to act as a consultant to improve services and processes

Usage notes

[edit]
  • In Quebec, the office in government services is called protecteur du citoyen. A similar office in France is that of the médiateur, though its precise functions differ.
trans: an appointed official within an organization whose duty is to investigate complaints against that organization by its customers, taxpayers, and sometimes employees, and often to act as a consultant to improve services and processes

an appointed official within an organization whose duty is to investigate complaints against that organization by its customers, taxpayers, and sometimes employees, and often to act as a consultant to improve services and processes

an appointed official within an organization whose duty is to investigate complaints against that organization by its customers, taxpayers, and sometimes employees, and often to act as a consultant to improve services and processes
